lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Zambia mines copper at a relatively expensive rate of 69 cents per pound, compared with 55 cents in the United States and under 40 cents in Chile.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But on May 1, President Kenneth Kaunda abolished the auctioning system, inspired by the International Monetary Fund, and announced Zambia would pursue a go-it-alone economic strategy based on national resources.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "We are still consulting to see how the new measures will affect us but it is too early to say just how we shall fare under the new situation," Peter Hansen, director of operations and third in the ZCCM hierarchy, told Reuters.
